study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy, safety, and cost-effectiveness of a standardized ginger root supplement as an adjuvant therapy for reducing chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in adults undergoing moderate-to-highly emetogenic chemotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract reports initial enrollment of 33 participants but does not provide results on efficacy or safety outcomes, as the study was ongoing at the time of reporting.
population_specificity: Adults undergoing single-day moderate-to-highly emetogenic chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 60 mg of active gingerols per day (four capsules total), administered from the day of chemotherapy and continuing for five days during chemotherapy cycles 1 to 3.
study_duration: Five days per chemotherapy cycle, across three cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ginger supplementation reduces proinflammatory factors in individuals with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: After 3 months, the ginger group showed decreased levels of TNF-α and IL-1β compared to the placebo group, suggesting potential anti-inflammatory benefits for knee osteoarthritis.
population_specificity: 120 participants with knee osteoarthritis in a randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if ginger supplementation could effectively improve chemotherapy-induced nausea-related quality of life as an adjuvant treatment.
results_summary: The study found that ginger supplementation significantly improved quality of life related to chemotherapy-induced nausea in the first cycle, with nausea being more prevalent than vomiting. Secondary outcomes included measures of acute and delayed nausea, vomiting, and retching, though full results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing chemotherapy (N = 51).
effective_dosage: 1.2 g of standardized ginger extract per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects of ginger in pulmonary tuberculosis (TB) patients.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation significantly reduced levels of TNF alpha, ferritin, and MDA compared to baseline and the control group, demonstrating anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects alongside standard anti-TB therapy.
population_specificity: 69 pulmonary TB patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ginger supplementation could protect against delayed, intercycle, and anticipatory nausea in patients receiving high-dose cisplatin chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in nausea incidence between ginger and placebo groups overall, but a modest benefit was observed in female and head-and-neck cancer patients. Ginger was deemed safe but did not provide broad protective effects against chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting.
population_specificity: Patients receiving high-dose cisplatin chemotherapy, primarily with lung (49%) or head-and-neck cancer (35%).
study_duration: From the day after cisplatin administration through the chemotherapy cycle.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ginger supplementation on serum lipids and lipoproteins in peritoneal dialysis (PD) patients.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation significantly reduced serum triglyceride concentration by 15% compared to baseline and placebo, but no significant effects were observed on total cholesterol, LDL-C, HDL-C, or Lp (a).
population_specificity: Peritoneal dialysis (PD) patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the prokinetic activity of Prodigest®, a standardized combination of ginger and artichoke extracts, on gastric motility in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: Prodigest® significantly promoted gastric emptying compared to placebo, with a -24% difference in gastric area after meals (p<0.001). The effect appeared more pronounced with two capsules, but the small sample size limited definitive conclusions on dose-related effects.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers (n=11)
effective_dosage: One capsule (standard dose) and two capsules (higher dose, tested in 3 subjects)
study_duration: Single administration per evaluation, with a 7-day interval between evaluations

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of ginger consumption on metabolic and clinical features of obesity in obese women.
results_summary: Ginger consumption significantly reduced BMI, serum insulin, HOMA-IR index, and increased QUICKI compared to placebo. It also showed significant reductions in serum leptin, resistin, and glucose, though body composition and adiponectin levels remained unchanged.
population_specificity: Obese women aged 18-45 years.
effective_dosage: 2 g/day of ginger powder (as two 1 g tablets).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of ginger supplementation on obesity-associated parameters, including body weight, BMI, and appetite, with a nutrigenetics approach.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation led to a slight but statistically significant decrease in anthropometric measurements and appetite scores, particularly in individuals with specific genotypes (AA for uncoupling protein 1 and Trp64Trp for ß3-adrenergic receptor gene). No significant changes were observed in body composition or dietary intake between groups.
population_specificity: 80 obese women aged 18-45 years.
effective_dosage: 2-g ginger rhizomes powder (two 1-g tablets per day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ginger supplementation on serum glucose, oxidative stress, and inflammatory markers in patients undergoing peritoneal dialysis.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation significantly reduced serum fasting glucose by up to 20% compared to placebo, but no significant differences were observed in other markers like oxidative stress or inflammatory indicators.
population_specificity: Patients on peritoneal dialysis (PD)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if ginger supplementation is effective for reducing muscle damage and delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS) after high-intensity resistance exercise.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation (4 g) accelerated recovery of muscle strength 48 hours post-exercise but did not reduce markers of muscle damage or DOMS. Blood creatine kinase levels continued to rise in the ginger group, and pain levels were unaffected by ginger.
population_specificity: 20 non-weight trained participants

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether standardized ginger extract is effective as an adjuvant treatment for chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV) in chemotherapy-naïve patients.
results_summary: The study design addresses previous limitations by using standardized ginger formulations, controlling for prognostic factors, and assessing additional outcomes like cancer-related fatigue and nutritional status. Results are pending as the abstract describes the trial's methodology rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Chemotherapy-naïve patients undergoing chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 1.2 g/day (300 mg per capsule, administered four times daily).
study_duration: Five days during the first three chemotherapy cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of ginger supplementation on glycemic indices, antioxidant capacity, and inflammatory markers in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation significantly improved glycemic indices (serum glucose, HbA1c, insulin resistance), reduced inflammation (CRP), and enhanced antioxidant capacity (TAC, PON-1 activity) compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Iranian patients with type 2 diabetes, aged 20-60 years, not receiving insulin.
effective_dosage: 3 g of powdered ginger daily (in capsules).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of ginger supplementation on insulin resistance and glycemic indices in patients with diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: The study found that daily ginger supplementation significantly reduced fasting blood sugar (10.5% decrease) and improved insulin resistance indices (e.g., QUICKI index) compared to placebo, which showed a 21% increase in fasting blood sugar.
population_specificity: 88 participants with diabetes mellitus.
effective_dosage: 3 one-gram capsules of ginger powder daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of a joint pain dietary supplement containing ginger root concentrate, among other ingredients, on joint pain, stiffness, and function in adults with self-reported joint pain.
results_summary: The supplement significantly reduced joint pain severity compared to placebo, with notable improvements in daily activities and stiffness, particularly in subjects with knee pain. However, no significant differences were observed in systemic inflammation biomarkers or physical function tests.
population_specificity: Adults aged 50-75 years with a history (>3 months) of joint pain.
effective_dosage: 3 colored gel capsules per day (specific ginger dosage not specified).
interactions: Subjects avoided NSAIDs and other joint pain medications/supplements during the study.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the single and combined effects of 6-week water-based exercise and oral ginger supplementation on oxidative stress biomarkers and adiponectin levels in obese women with breast cancer.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation alone or combined with water-based exercise increased adiponectin, nitric oxide (NO), and glutathione peroxidase (GPx) while reducing malondialdehyde (MDA). The combined intervention showed significantly better effects on these biomarkers compared to either intervention alone or placebo.
population_specificity: Obese women (48 ± 5.4 years, 76 ± 9 kg, fat mass 41.8 ± 4%) diagnosed with breast cancer.
effective_dosage: 4 capsules daily (each containing 750 mg ginger), 7 days a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of ginger (Zingiber officinale) on biochemical parameters, including insulin sensitivity and lipid profiles, in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation significantly improved insulin sensitivity (reduced insulin levels and HOMA index, increased QUICKI index) and lowered LDL-C and triglyceride levels, but did not significantly affect fasting blood glucose, total cholesterol, HDL-C, or HbA1c.
population_specificity: 64 patients with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the pharmacologic properties, efficacy, and safety of ginger for nausea and vomiting in pregnancy.
results_summary: Ginger was found to be efficacious for nausea and vomiting in pregnancy, but its safety data were limited. The recommendation for its use was tentative and dependent on practitioner comfort with available safety data.
population_specificity: Pregnant women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of ginger on apoptosis, proliferation, and differentiation in the normal-appearing colonic mucosa of individuals at increased risk for colorectal cancer.
results_summary: Ginger supplementation led to a decrease in hTERT and MIB-1 expression, suggesting reduced proliferation, and showed potential effects on apoptosis and differentiation, particularly in the differentiation zone of crypts. However, changes in Bax expression were inconsistent, and p21 and Bcl-2 remained relatively unchanged.
population_specificity: 20 individuals at increased risk for colorectal cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether raw or heat-treated ginger supplementation could reduce muscle pain caused by eccentric exercise in humans.
results_summary: Both raw and heat-treated ginger significantly reduced muscle pain (25% and 23%, respectively) 24 hours after eccentric exercise compared to placebo, with smaller effects on other measures. Heat treatment did not enhance ginger's pain-relieving effects.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers (34 in study 1, 40 in study 2) performing eccentric elbow flexor exercises.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic effects of GBE50 (a Ginkgo biloba extract) on neurovascular unit integrity and cognitive impairment in an Alzheimer's disease mouse model.
results_summary: GBE50 significantly improved cognitive deficits, enhanced cerebrovascular structure and function, restored neurovascular unit components, promoted Aβ clearance, and reduced neuroinflammation in APP/PS1 mice. Bioinformatics analyses suggested these effects were mediated through pathways related to vascular repair, neuroprotection, and Aβ clearance.
population_specificity: APP/PS1 transgenic mice (an Alzheimer's disease model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the dose and efficacy of ginger in reducing the severity of chemotherapy-induced nausea on Day 1 of chemotherapy.
results_summary: All doses of ginger significantly reduced acute nausea severity compared to placebo on Day 1 of chemotherapy, with the largest reductions occurring at 0.5 g and 1.0 g doses. Anticipatory nausea was identified as a key factor in acute chemotherapy-induced nausea.
population_specificity: 576 adult cancer patients (91% female, mean age = 53) receiving chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 0.5 g, 1.0 g, or 1.5 g ginger (250 mg capsules, taken twice daily for 6 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Ginkgo Biloba with donepezil provides additional cognitive benefits and reduces plasma MDS-Oaβ levels in amyloid PET-positive Alzheimer's disease patients.
results_summary: The Donepezil-Ginkgo group showed significant improvement in cognitive scores (K-MMSE) and a greater reduction in plasma MDS-Oaβ compared to the Donepezil-only group, though no significant difference was observed in CDR-SB. Adverse events were mild and did not lead to discontinuation.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed, drug-naïve Alzheimer's disease patients who were amyloid PET-positive.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) in treating idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) by evaluating its impact on respiratory function, inflammation, and fibrosis markers.
results_summary: GBE significantly improved respiratory function (e.g., arterial oxygen levels, lung capacity) and reduced markers of inflammation and fibrosis in IPF patients compared to controls. The findings suggest GBE may be a beneficial adjunct therapy for IPF.
population_specificity: Patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) (1043 participants across 14 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neurobiological effects of Ginkgo Biloba extract (EGb) for treating spinal cord injury (SCI) in rats.
results_summary: EGb administration significantly improved motor function, reduced lipid peroxidation, inhibited inflammation, and promoted nerve growth in rats with SCI. The most effective dosage range was 10-50 mg/kg.
population_specificity: Rats with spinal cord injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compile the efficacy and safety of Ginkgo biloba extract EGb 761® across various clinical conditions by reviewing systematic reviews.
results_summary: EGb 761® showed potential benefits for neurocognitive disorders, tinnitus, macular degeneration, and schizophrenia, with most reviews supporting its efficacy for cognition and behavioral symptoms. However, methodological quality of the reviews was poor, and results should be interpreted cautiously.
population_specificity: Patients with neurocognitive disorders, tinnitus, macular degeneration, and schizophrenia, as well as healthy subjects for prevention or health promotion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how drought, salt stress, and their combination affect leaf nitrogen allocation, mesophyll conductance, and photosynthesis in Ginkgo biloba.
results_summary: All stress treatments significantly reduced photosynthesis in Ginkgo biloba, with combined drought-salt stress having the most inhibitory effect. The study found that increased mesophyll conductance limitation under combined stress was linked to altered nitrogen allocation, favoring non-photosynthetic structures over photosynthetic enzymes.
population_specificity: Ginkgo biloba plants under controlled stress conditions (drought, salt, and combined drought-salt stress).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, safety, and cost-effectiveness of caroverine alone, caroverine combined with ginkgo biloba, and betahistine alone in treating moderate tinnitus.
results_summary: The combination of caroverine and ginkgo biloba showed the greatest reduction in tinnitus handicap inventory (THI), tinnitus functional index (TFI), and Visual Analog Scale (VAS) scores compared to the other treatments. All treatments were well-tolerated with mild and non-serious adverse effects.
population_specificity: 72 patients with moderate tinnitus, equally distributed into three treatment groups.
effective_dosage: Ginkgo biloba 120 mg twice daily (combined with caroverine 20 mg twice daily).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Ginkgo Biloba extract on macular and peripapillary perfusion parameters in patients with treated early-to-moderate primary open-angle glaucoma.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in macular perfusion density and a statistically significant but clinically insignificant reduction in peripapillary perfusion density after 4 months of Ginkgo Biloba supplementation. No differences were observed in the control group.
population_specificity: Patients with early-to-moderate primary open-angle glaucoma (≥10 dB MD), matched with controls by age, sex, and glaucoma status.
effective_dosage: 120 mg oral Ginkgo Biloba extract twice daily

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms by which Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) improves acute ischemic stroke (AIS) prognosis, focusing on its impact on platelet activity, coagulation function, and potential bleeding risk.
results_summary: GBE inhibited arachidonic acid-induced platelet aggregation and prolonged thrombin time and APTT. Combined with low-dose aspirin, GBE further reduced platelet aggregation but increased minor bleeding risk.
population_specificity: 99 patients, including those with internal jugular venous stenosis (IJVS) and acute ischemic stroke (AIS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the treatment effects of Ginkgo biloba extract EGb 761 in patients with mild dementia through a meta-analysis of randomized placebo-controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that 240 mg EGb 761 daily significantly improved cognition, global assessment, activities of daily living, and quality of life compared to placebo, with medium to large standardized effects. Adverse event frequency was similar between EGb 761 and placebo groups.
population_specificity: Patients with mild dementia (SKT Short Cognitive Performance Test total scores 9-15).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize recent advancements in understanding the pharmacological and toxicological effects of ginkgolic acids (GAs) in Ginkgo Biloba, including their mechanisms.
results_summary: GAs exhibit significant antitumor, anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, and antiviral properties but also pose risks of liver and kidney damage, oxidative stress, and cellular apoptosis. Their concentration in standardized extracts is regulated to mitigate toxicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).
effective_dosage: Not specified (mentions regulated concentration of ≤5 ppm in EGb 761).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical efficacy and safety of Ginkgo biloba combined with Nicorandil in improving heart function, blood lipid levels, blood glucose levels, renal function, exercise tolerance, and quality of life in patients with HFmrEF.
results_summary: The study found that Ginkgo biloba combined with Nicorandil significantly improved multiple clinical parameters (e.g., LVEF, blood lipids, exercise tolerance) and quality of life compared to standard treatment, with no significant difference in adverse reactions between groups.
population_specificity: 316 patients with heart failure and mild reduction in ejection fraction (HFmrEF).
effective_dosage: Not specified (oral administration, exact dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb) could enhance memory and reduce anxiety-like behavior in female mice with varying reductions in the acetylcholine transporter (VAChT).
results_summary: Chronic EGb treatment significantly improved long-term memory in female VAChT KDHOM mice in a dose-dependent manner, correlated with increased VAChT-immunopositive cells in the dCA1 hippocampal subfield. EGb also reduced anxiety-like behavior in VAChT KDHET mice, associated with decreased VAChT-immunopositive cells in the dDG subfield.
population_specificity: Three-month-old female mice with severe (VAChT KDHOM), moderate (VAChT KDHET), or no (WT) reductions in VAChT.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) as an adjunctive therapy to conventional renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system inhibitors for diabetic kidney disease (DKD) patients.
results_summary: The study found that combining GBE with ACEI/ARB improved multiple kidney and metabolic markers (e.g., urinary albumin excretion rate, serum creatinine, cholesterol levels) but had minimal impact on glucose and blood pressure. No significant difference in adverse events was detected, suggesting good tolerability.
population_specificity: Diabetic kidney disease (DKD) patients (3,269 participants across 41 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate sex-dependent effects of EGb 761® on cognitive function and neuroinflammation in an Alzheimer's disease mouse model, as well as identify the microglial subtype responsible for its anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: EGb 761® improved cognitive function, reduced amyloid plaque load, and exhibited sex-specific effects on AD-related gene expression. It also showed anti-inflammatory effects, particularly reducing TNFα-response, and primarily affected disease-associated microglia stage 2 (DAM2).
population_specificity: 5xFAD mice (an Alzheimer's disease mouse model) and wild-type mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how heat stress affects stomatal initiation and development in Ginkgo biloba seedlings and its implications for reconstructing paleo-atmospheric CO2 concentrations.
results_summary: Heat stress impaired photosynthetic function, decreased stomatal conductance, and reduced stomatal index in Ginkgo biloba seedlings, leading to greater estimates of CO2 based on stomatal methods. The study found that heat stress undermines the reliability of stomatal-based paleo-CO2 reconstructions during global warming periods.
population_specificity: Ginkgo biloba seedlings grown in controlled environment chambers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms by which EGb761 (a Ginkgo Biloba extract) enhances neuronal proliferation and migration in vascular dementia (VD) models, focusing on the RhoA-ROCK2 signaling pathway.
results_summary: EGb761 improved the viability, proliferation, and migration of HT22 cells under oxygen-glucose deprivation and reoxygenation (OGD/R) conditions by targeting the RhoA-ROCK2 pathway. The study identified RHOA and BCL-2 as potential targets of Ginkgo Biloba, with enriched pathways related to growth hormone and neurotrophin signaling.
population_specificity: HT-22 mouse hippocampal neuronal cells and VD rat models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the mechanism by which Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) alleviates chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and its effects on ferroptosis and inflammatory markers.
results_summary: GBE treatment reduced cell and lung tissue damage, inhibited ferroptosis, decreased inflammatory factors (IL-6, IL-8, TNF-α), and improved cell viability in COPD models. It acted via the miR-3,619-5p/GPX4 axis to mitigate oxidative stress and inflammation.
population_specificity: Cell (HBE) and animal models of COPD induced by cigarette smoke extract (CSE) and cigarette smoke (CS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety profile of Ginkgo biloba extract by analyzing adverse event reports from the FAERS database.
results_summary: The study identified 700 adverse event reports linked to Ginkgo biloba extract, affecting 23 organ systems, with 88 significant mismatches detected. The median onset time for adverse events was 7 days, with most occurring within the first week of treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (data from FAERS database, likely diverse global population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the composition, pharmacological data, and clinical evidence of ginkgo biloba leaf extract for treating Alzheimer's disease (AD).
results_summary: The study found that ginkgo biloba extract (EGb 761) has demonstrated effects on various pathophysiological features of cognitive impairment and neurodegeneration, with clinical trials supporting its efficacy in treating AD and cognitive decline, though results show heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Patients with Alzheimer's disease and related dementia conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the physiological and transcriptomic mechanisms of Ginkgo biloba's response to drought stress and re-watering.
results_summary: The study identified significant changes in physiological characteristics and differentially expressed genes (DEGs) during drought and re-watering, highlighting pathways like plant hormone signal transduction and transcription factors (TFs) as key regulators of drought response. Six TFs were confirmed as positive or negative regulators of drought stress response.
population_specificity: Ginkgo biloba seedlings
study_duration: Drought treatment for 15 and 22 days, followed by re-watering for 3 days

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the molecular mechanism by which methyl jasmonate (MeJA) treatment increases terpene trilactone (TTL) accumulation in Ginkgo biloba and to explore the role of specific transcription factors in this process.
results_summary: The study found that MeJA treatment induced the expression of GbMYC2 transcription factors, which interact with GbJAZs and regulate TTL biosynthesis by targeting GbGGPPS. Overexpression of GbMYC2_4 and GbMYC2_5 significantly increased TTL content in Arabidopsis roots.
population_specificity: In vitro and Arabidopsis model systems (not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (exogenous MeJA treatment used, but exact dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of Ginkgo Biloba and caroverine in managing idiopathic tinnitus using the Tinnitus Functional Index (TFI).
results_summary: Ginkgo Biloba significantly reduced moderate tinnitus severity by 50% and completely resolved severe tinnitus symptoms (-100% change) after 6 months of treatment. The results were statistically significant (p < 0.0001).
population_specificity: Patients with chronic idiopathic tinnitus at a tertiary care hospital in North India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the medical usefulness and mechanism of Ginkgo Biloba Extract (GBE) in managing elderly ischemic cerebrovascular disease (ICVD).
results_summary: GBE significantly improved neurological function, reduced inflammatory markers, enhanced cerebral circulation, and improved daily living ability in elderly ICVD patients compared to conventional treatment, with no significant difference in adverse reactions.
population_specificity: Elderly patients (120 cases) with ischemic cerebrovascular disease (ICVD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the therapeutic effect of Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb 761) on sudden sensorineural hearing loss (SSNHL) and its influence on hemorheology.
results_summary: The study found that EGb 761 combined with routine treatment significantly improved hearing thresholds, hemorheological parameters, and reduced inflammatory markers compared to routine treatment alone, with a higher total effective rate (90.74% vs. 72.73%). No serious adverse reactions were observed.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with SSNHL at Wendeng Hospital of Traditional Chinese Orthopedics and Traumatology of Shandong Province.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic effects of Ginkgo biloba leaf extract (GBE) on Alzheimer's disease (AD) and explore its potential mechanisms of action.
results_summary: GBE improved cognitive function, enhanced neuronal morphology, and reduced serum inflammatory factors in mice. Its effects may be attributed to modulation of the PI3K/AKT/NF-κB signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Mice (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyperspectral imaging technology for rapid, non-destructive detection of total flavonoid content in Ginkgo biloba leaves.
results_summary: The study found that hyperspectral imaging, particularly using Bayesian Ridge (BR) and multiplicative scatter correction (MCS), accurately predicted total flavonoid content (RTest2 = 0.87; RMSETest = 1.03 mg/g). Additionally, leaf cracks were correlated with higher flavonoid content, aiding in quicker quality assessment.
population_specificity: Ginkgo biloba leaves (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo biloba extract (Gbex) could protect Allium cepa (onion) from phytotoxicity, genotoxicity, and oxidative damage induced by the fungicide trifloxystrobin (TFS).
results_summary: Ginkgo biloba extract mitigated TFS-induced damage in Allium cepa, reducing oxidative stress, chromosomal abnormalities, and cellular damage in a dose-dependent manner, likely due to its high phenolic content.
population_specificity: Allium cepa (onion) bulbs

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the drug utilization of Ginkgo biloba extract (Gbe) for acute tinnitus and compare its association with repeat ENT visits to systemic corticosteroids and pentoxifylline.
results_summary: Gbe was the most frequently prescribed drug for acute tinnitus and was associated with significantly lower odds of repeat ENT consultations compared to systemic corticosteroids and pentoxifylline. The effect was consistent across genders and some age groups.
population_specificity: Patients in Germany diagnosed with acute tinnitus and treated by ENT specialists between 2005 and 2021.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-neuroinflammatory potential of Ginkgo Biloba extract EGb 761 in LPS-stimulated BV2 microglial cells.
results_summary: The study found that EGb 761 significantly inhibited LPS-induced expression and release of cytokines (TNF-α, IL-6) and chemokines (CXCL2, CXCL10, CCL2, CCL3) in BV2 microglial cells, likely mediated by MAPK, PKC, and NF-κB signaling pathways.
population_specificity: BV2 microglial cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Ginkgo biloba extract with nimodipine improves cognitive function and daily living abilities in Parkinson's disease patients.
results_summary: The combination of Ginkgo biloba extract and nimodipine significantly improved cognitive function and daily living abilities compared to nimodipine alone, with a higher total effective rate (90.36% vs. 72.29%).
population_specificity: 551 patients with Parkinson's disease, later matched to 83 pairs for comparison.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanisms of action of Ginkgo Biloba extracts in treating inflammatory skin diseases and skin ageing, as well as explore nanomedicine strategies to enhance efficacy and reduce side effects.
results_summary: Ginkgo Biloba extracts show potential in regulating oxidative stress and angiogenesis, with compounds like ginkgetin and ginkgolide K inhibiting aberrant angiogenesis in eczema/psoriasis and improving microcirculation in ageing skin. The extract may also control pruritus in atopic dermatitis via neuroprotective and anti-inflammatory mechanisms, though its full mechanisms remain unclear.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).
interactions: Mentioned (side effects and drug interactions noted, but specifics not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Ginkgo Biloba and its bioactive components as adjuvant therapy for myocardial remodeling and heart failure, comparing its effects to those of ginseng.
results_summary: The study found that Ginkgo Biloba leaf extract and its terpene trilactones (ginkgolides) produce anti-remodeling effects in experimental models, similar to ginseng, through mechanisms like antioxidant and antiapoptotic effects and inhibition of pro-hypertrophic signaling. However, robust clinical evidence from large-scale trials is lacking.
population_specificity: Experimental models (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of ginkgo biloba extract combined with donepezil versus donepezil alone for treating vascular dementia (VaD).
results_summary: The study found that combination therapy significantly improved total effective rate, cognitive function (MMSE), daily living abilities (BI, ADL), and reduced certain blood viscosity markers (HCY, PV, BVH, BVL) in VaD patients, though it had no notable effect on middle cerebral artery flow velocity or pulse index.
population_specificity: Patients with vascular dementia (VaD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential synergistic effects of Cistanche tubulosa and Ginkgo biloba (CG) on cognitive function in middle-aged and elderly individuals at risk of neurodegenerative diseases.
results_summary: The CG group showed significant improvements in cognitive function (Mini-Mental State Examination, Montreal Cognitive Assessment, and World Health Organization Quality of Life scores) and memory (Cognitrax matrix test and Wechsler Memory Scale-Revised), along with favorable changes in cognitive-related blood biomarkers. No treatment-related adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Chinese middle-aged and elderly participants at risk of neurodegenerative diseases.
effective_dosage: Two tablets daily, each pair containing 72 mg echinacoside and 27 mg flavonol glycosides.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Ginkgo biloba (GB) in improving cognitive function, neuropsychiatric symptoms, and functional abilities in patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and dementia.
results_summary: Eleven out of fifteen clinical trials showed that GB extract/EGb 761® improved cognitive function, neuropsychiatric symptoms, and functional abilities in dementia patients, while four studies found no significant differences compared to placebo. Significant improvements were noted in MMSE, SKT, and NPI scores.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with Alzheimer's disease and dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba extract (EGb761) improves tardive dyskinesia (TD) symptoms and increases MnSOD activity, particularly in TD patients with the MnSOD Val-9Ala genotype.
results_summary: EGb761 significantly reduced TD symptoms and increased MnSOD activity compared to placebo, with greater improvement observed in patients carrying the Ala allele of the MnSOD Ala-9Val polymorphism. Baseline MnSOD activity was lower in TD patients than in healthy or non-TD controls.
population_specificity: 157 TD patients in the clinical trial; expanded sample included 159 TD, 227 non-TD, and 280 healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy of Ginkgo biloba extract EGb 761 (GBE) in treating L-arginine-induced acute pancreatitis (AP) and associated lung injury in rats.
results_summary: GBE reduced elevated serum amylase, lipase, and inflammatory mediators (TNF-α, MAPK-P38, JNK1, NF-κB) and restored pancreatic gene expression of TLR4 and PAP-2. Histopathological findings confirmed GBE's protective effects on pancreatic and lung tissues.
population_specificity: Forty rats divided into four groups, including a normal saline group and L-arginine-induced AP groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of lysine acetylation in flavonoid biosynthesis in Ginkgo biloba.
results_summary: The study identified 11,788 lysine acetylation sites on 4,324 proteins, including 12 acetylated proteins linked to flavonoid biosynthesis. Treatment with trichostatin A increased flavonoid levels in roots, and expression levels of specific genes correlated with flavonoid content variations in different tissues.
population_specificity: Ginkgo biloba plant tissues (roots, stems, leaves)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically summarize the pharmacological mechanisms and therapeutic effects of Ginkgo biloba leaves (GBLs) in treating neurological disorders (NDs) by analyzing preclinical and clinical studies.
results_summary: GBLs were found to improve memory, cognition, behavior, and psychopathology in NDs, with the most common conditions treated being depression, Alzheimer's disease, stroke, Huntington's disease, and Parkinson's disease. The mechanisms included free radical scavenging, antioxidant activity, anti-inflammatory response, mitochondrial protection, neurotransmitter regulation, and antagonism of PAF.
population_specificity: Patients with neurological disorders (depression, Alzheimer's disease, stroke, Huntington's disease, Parkinson's disease) and preclinical models (cell and animal studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of Ginkgo biloba leaf powder as a substrate component to enhance the yield and quality of king oyster mushrooms (Pleurotus eryngii).
results_summary: The study found that a substrate with 21% Ginkgo biloba leaf powder (Y1) resulted in the highest mushroom yield (303.1 ± 31.9 g) and improved crude fiber content (7.43%) compared to the control. Additionally, Y1 showed the highest laccase activity, indicating better mycelial colonization.
population_specificity: King oyster mushrooms (Pleurotus eryngii) cultivated on experimental substrates.
effective_dosage: 10.5% and 21% Ginkgo biloba leaf powder in substrate formulations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic potential of Ginkgo biloba leaf extract (GB) in combination with L-carnitine (LC) for ameliorating hyperlipidemia and hepatosteatosis induced by a high-cholesterol diet in rats.
results_summary: GB supplementation, especially when combined with LC, reduced serum lipid and glucose markers, improved antioxidant capacity, and reduced liver steatosis and fibrosis. The combination therapy also upregulated immune expression of GLP-1 and β-Cat in liver sections, resembling control levels.
population_specificity: 50 rats divided into five groups, including a high-cholesterol diet group and treatment groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of different Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) preparations in treating unstable angina pectoris (UAP) and identify the most effective formulations.
results_summary: GBE preparations combined with conventional treatment improved angina symptoms and ECG results more effectively than conventional treatment alone. Shuxuening injection was the most effective for symptom relief, while Ginkgo tablets performed best among oral formulations, with no severe adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Patients with unstable angina pectoris (UAP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of Ginkgo biloba (Gb) extracts in treating Alzheimer's disease (AD) by summarizing insights from traditional Chinese medicine, experimental models, and clinical trials.
results_summary: Ginkgo biloba extracts demonstrated significant therapeutic effects on AD, including neuroprotective, anti-inflammatory, and neurotransmitter-modulating properties, with few adverse reactions. The study highlights Gb as a promising alternative treatment for neurodegenerative diseases.
population_specificity: Patients with Alzheimer's disease and related neurodegenerative conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a Bacillus mixture in controlling ginkgo leaf blight and promoting ginkgo growth.
results_summary: The Bacillus mixture significantly reduced lesion area by >40%, improved ginkgo resistance to leaf blight, increased biomass (leaf weight, area, thickness, root weight), and enhanced rhizosphere soil health by boosting beneficial microorganisms and reducing pathogens.
population_specificity: Ginkgo plants affected by leaf blight (Alternaria tenuissima).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects and mechanisms of Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) on skin fibrosis in a bleomycin-induced systemic sclerosis (SSc) mouse model.
results_summary: GBE significantly reduced dermal thickness and profibrotic factors in the SSc mouse model, inhibited gene expression of COL1A1, α-SMA, and CTGF in fibroblasts, and suppressed TGF-β signaling. It also prevented adipocyte transdifferentiation into myofibroblasts, suggesting therapeutic potential for SSc.
population_specificity: Bleomycin-induced systemic sclerosis (SSc) mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether Ginkgo Biloba could protect the blood-brain barrier and reduce inflammation and oxidative stress in mice infected with Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense and treated with melarsoprol.
results_summary: Co-administration of Ginkgo Biloba and melarsoprol improved survival rates, protected the blood-brain barrier, reduced oxidative stress, and stabilized inflammatory markers in infected mice. Ginkgo Biloba also prevented anemia, thrombocytopenia, and organ damage.
population_specificity: Mice infected with Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a π-complexing adsorbent (AgBF4/IL•MCM-41) for enriching polyprenols from Ginkgo biloba leaves extract.
results_summary: The π-complexing adsorbent demonstrated excellent adsorption performance (153 mg/g at 30°C) and fast adsorption rate (equilibrium reached in 210 s), increasing PPs content from 38.54% to 70.2% with an 86.6% recovery rate. The adsorbent also showed good reusability for ≥3 cycles.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the quality of systematic reviews and meta-analyses evaluating the efficacy of Ginkgo biloba L. preparations (GBLPs) as an adjuvant treatment for ischemic stroke.
results_summary: The study found that GBLPs, when used with conventional treatment, were superior to conventional treatment alone in improving neurological function scores. However, the overall quality of evidence was low, with most outcomes rated as very low or low quality.
population_specificity: Patients with ischemic stroke.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of exogenous melatonin on Ginkgo biloba seedlings' osmotic regulation and antioxidant capacity under varying levels of salt stress.
results_summary: Saline stress inhibited osmoregulation and antioxidant capacities in Ginkgo biloba seedlings. Low to moderate melatonin concentrations (0.02, 0.1 mmol·L-1) improved growth, reduced electrolyte leakage, and enhanced enzyme activity, while high concentrations (0.5 mmol·L-1) worsened stress.
population_specificity: 4-year-old Ginkgo biloba seedlings
effective_dosage: Melatonin solution (0, 0.02, 0.1, 0.5 mmol·L-1) applied via leaf spray and soil watering

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the mechanisms by which Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) exerts protective effects in patients suffering from arsenic poisoning (arsenism).
results_summary: The study found that GBE intervention reversed 30 out of 35 disordered metabolites in arsenism patients, promoting immune response, anti-inflammatory functions, and alleviating oxidative stress. These changes suggest GBE's protective role against arsenic toxicity.
population_specificity: 39 coal-burning type arsenism patients and 50 healthy residents from Guizhou province, China.
effective_dosage: Orally administered GBE three times per day (exact dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antibacterial effects and mechanisms of different Ginkgo biloba exocarp extract (GBEE) fractions against MRSA and Staphylococcus haemolyticus biofilms in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: GBEE fractions, particularly the petroleum ether-extracted fraction (GBEE-PE), showed significant antibacterial activity, inhibiting MRSA and S. haemolyticus biofilm formation by altering ion transport, cell wall metabolism, and virulence-related gene expression. GBEE-PE at 20 mg/kg was nontoxic in LO2 cell viability and H. illucens toxicity assays.
population_specificity: Clinical bacterial isolates (15 MRSA and S. haemolyticus strains) and model mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the clinical efficacy and safety of standardized Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) as an adjuvant treatment for intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH).
results_summary: The meta-analysis of 19 RCTs found that GBE combined with conventional treatment improved outcomes (higher effective rate, lower NIHSS/CSS scores, reduced hematoma/edema, higher ADL/MoCA scores, lower inflammatory markers) with no significant difference in adverse reactions compared to conventional treatment alone.
population_specificity: Patients with intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Ginkgo Biloba could address cognitive impairment, depression, and fatigue in post-COVID syndrome due to its multi-target pharmacological properties.
results_summary: Ginkgo Biloba showed positive effects on cognitive impairment, mental fatigue, and depressive symptoms in some studies, though the data are preliminary and require further validation. Its broad pharmacological spectrum, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, suggests potential efficacy for post-COVID symptoms.
population_specificity: Individuals with post-COVID syndrome experiencing cognitive impairment, depression, and fatigue.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the active components of Ginkgo biloba leaves and their potential mechanisms in treating non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
results_summary: The study identified key components (quercetin, luteolin, kaempferol) that may act on targets like Tp53, AKT1, and TNF, suggesting involvement in PI3K-AKT and MAPK signaling pathways. Molecular docking confirmed strong affinity between these components and targets.
population_specificity: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) (in silico study, no human participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of Ginkgo biloba dropping pill (GBDP) as an adjuvant therapy for stable angina pectoris (SAP) complicated by depression.
results_summary: GBDP significantly improved angina stability and quality of life (SF-36 scores) compared to placebo, with a trend toward reduced angina frequency. It also alleviated depressive symptoms (HAMD scores) without increasing adverse reactions.
population_specificity: Patients with stable angina pectoris complicated by depression (n=68 completed the study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the molecular mechanisms and signaling pathways of Ginkgo Biloba to assess its potential as a novel treatment for various illnesses.
results_summary: Ginkgo Biloba exhibits multiple therapeutic properties, including anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, anti-apoptotic, and neuroprotective effects, mediated through various signaling pathways such as NF-κB, Nrf-2, and AMPK. The study highlights its potential for treating diverse conditions but does not provide specific clinical outcome data.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of molecular mechanisms, not a clinical trial).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the hepatoprotective effect of Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) on carbon tetrachloride (CCl4)-induced acute liver injury in vitro and identify key signaling pathways involved.
results_summary: GBE significantly reduced ALT, AST, and MDA levels while increasing SOD and CAT activities, indicating reduced oxidative stress. It also decreased inflammatory markers (IL-1β, IL-6, TNF-α) and activated the PI3K/AKT pathway, suggesting protective effects against CCl4-induced liver damage.
population_specificity: In vitro study (cell-based model of CCl4-induced acute liver injury).
effective_dosage: Not specified (only referred to as EGB-L and EGB-H groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the binding affinity of Ginkgo Biloba-derived polyphenolic compounds to key colorectal cancer biomarkers to identify potential inhibitors for CRC treatment.
results_summary: The study found strong binding affinities between selected Ginkgo Biloba polyphenolic compounds and CRC-related biomarkers, suggesting potential inhibitory effects on CRC progression. The flavonol glycosides exhibited promising docking scores, indicating substantial interactions with targeted genes.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico molecular docking study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba leaf extract (GBE) could improve platelet recovery in a rat model of chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia.
results_summary: GBE did not significantly change platelet counts in healthy or thrombocytopenic rats but was associated with more rapid platelet count recovery compared to the CIT group, with a mean decrease of 14.24% from baseline on day 11.
population_specificity: Male Sprague Dawley rats with chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the beneficial effects of EGb 761 (Ginkgo Biloba extract) on cognitive performance and Alzheimer's disease-like changes in a rat model, comparing it to memantine.
results_summary: EGb 761 reversed memory and learning deficits, inhibited acetylcholinesterase, caspase-3, amyloid-beta, phosphorylated tau, and proinflammatory cytokines more effectively than memantine, and improved oxidative stress markers.
population_specificity: Scopolamine-heavy metals mixture rat Alzheimer's disease model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb) in alleviating symptoms of drug-induced parkinsonism (DIP) in psychiatric patients.
results_summary: Ginkgo biloba reduced the intensity of rest tremors, motor symptoms, rigidity, and bradykinesia, and improved components of working memory and short-term memory in patients with DIP.
population_specificity: Psychiatric patients with symptoms of drug-induced parkinsonism (n=63).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the regulatory effects of Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb) on intestinal flora and microbial metabolism in an Alzheimer's disease (AD) mouse model.
results_summary: EGb treatment improved spatial memory in AD mice, reshaped gut microbiome composition (reducing Firmicutes/Bacteroides ratio and increasing specific bacterial abundances), and reversed microbial metabolic dysfunction by modulating 300 differential metabolites.
population_specificity: APP/PS1 mice (Alzheimer's disease model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the audiologic outcomes of Ginkgo biloba monotherapy versus Ginkgo biloba and choline alfoscerate combination therapy for presbycusis.
results_summary: The combination therapy showed a slower rate of hearing loss and better survival time of hearing compared to monotherapy, as indicated by pure tone audiometry and Kaplan-Meier analysis.
population_specificity: Patients with presbycusis (age-related hearing loss).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether ginkgo biloba extract (EGb761) could alleviate hepatocyte senescence and liver damage induced by subchronic arsenic exposure in rats.
results_summary: EGb761 reduced pathological liver damage, inflammation, oxidative stress, and cellular senescence markers caused by arsenic exposure, and also decreased arsenic accumulation in liver tissues.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats (180-200 g)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the mechanism by which Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) exerts its anti-depressant effects, focusing on gut microbial metabolism.
results_summary: GBE alleviated stress-induced depression-like behaviors in mice by modulating gut microbiota and bile acid metabolism, specifically involving Parasutterella excrementihominis and ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA). The protective effects were transferable via fecal microbiome transplantation and abolished by antibiotics.
population_specificity: Mice subjected to unpredictable mild stress (UMS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and evaluate bioactive compounds in Ginkgo biloba fruit for their estrogen-like effects, particularly focusing on their potential to aid in controlling estrogenic activity during menopause.
results_summary: The study isolated 11 compounds from Ginkgo biloba fruit, with compounds 2, 3, 4, 8, and 9 showing estrogen-like effects by promoting cell proliferation in MCF-7 cells, which was mitigated by an ER antagonist. Syringin (2) notably increased cell proliferation by 140.9 ± 6.5% at 100 µM and induced ERα phosphorylation, suggesting potential benefits for menopausal estrogenic activity control.
population_specificity: MCF-7 cells (a human breast cancer cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the role of nitrate transporters (GbNRTs) in regulating nitrate uptake and their potential impact on browning during Ginkgo callus induction.
results_summary: The study identified 74 potential GbNRTs and analyzed their expression patterns, revealing their involvement in nitrate uptake and modulation of auxin and polyphenol biosynthesis, which may influence browning in Ginkgo callus. The findings suggest GbNRTs play a key role in nitrate utilization and could help develop efficient regeneration systems.
population_specificity: Ginkgo callus (in vitro culture)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether EGb-761 (Ginkgo Biloba) could mitigate the toxic effects of sodium metabisulfite (SMB) in mice.
results_summary: EGb-761 effectively reversed SMB-induced weight loss, blood disorders, and organ damage, while also reducing oxidative stress and inflammation markers. It also corrected metabolic and lipid imbalances caused by SMB.
population_specificity: Male Swiss white mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the antiviral activity of Ginkgo biloba polyphenolic compounds against variola by analyzing their interactions with key enzymes using molecular docking.
results_summary: The study found that Liquiritin, Olivil, and ginkgolic acids showed promising inhibitory potential against variola-related enzymes, with favorable physicochemical properties for drug development. Ginkgolic acids also demonstrated antimicrobial properties but may cause allergic reactions.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically summarize the molecular mechanisms of Ginkgo Biloba leaves (GBLs) in anti-cancer effects across cellular, animal, and clinical studies, and evaluate their efficacy and safety.
results_summary: The study found that GBLs exhibit anti-cancer properties by promoting apoptosis, inhibiting proliferation and migration, and modulating signaling pathways, with notable effects on lung, liver, gastric, breast, colorectal, and cervical cancers. The pharmacology, toxicology, and clinical research on GBLs were also discussed, reinforcing its potential for cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Cellular, animal models, and clinical trials involving various cancer types (lung, hepatocellular carcinoma, gastric, breast, colorectal, cervical).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Ginkgo Biloba (EGb 761) with Aspirin improves blood oxygen saturation and long-term efficacy in ischemic stroke patients with cerebral microbleeds.
results_summary: The study found that Ginkgo Biloba combined with Aspirin increased venous oxygen saturation in patients, with long-term benefits observed at 3 and 6 months. The effect was negatively correlated with modified mRS grade scores, indicating potential clinical relevance.
population_specificity: Ischemic stroke patients with cerebral microbleeds (49 participants, split into Aspirin-only and Aspirin + Ginkgo Biloba groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether immunomodulation plays a role in the beneficial effects of Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb) on ischemia/reperfusion (I/R) brain injury in mice.
results_summary: EGb significantly reduced neurobehavioral deficits, infarct volume, and inflammatory cytokines in I/R mice, while increasing the proportion of Treg cells. Depletion of Treg cells weakened EGb's neuroprotective effects, and EGb suppressed the HIF-1α/HK2 pathway to promote Treg differentiation.
population_specificity: Mice with induced ischemia/reperfusion brain injury

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effect of Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) against hyperglycaemic stress-induced injury in enteric glial cells (EGCs) and its underlying mechanism in diabetic gastrointestinal dysfunction (DGD).
results_summary: GBE significantly reduced hyperglycaemic stress-induced cytotoxicity and apoptosis in EGCs, both in vitro and in vivo, by regulating immune-related pathways, particularly TLR2/BTK/NF-κB/IL-1α/IL-10. The study demonstrated consistent protective effects across cell and animal models.
population_specificity: CRL-2690 cells (in vitro) and STZ-induced diabetic C57BL/6J WT mice (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the bioaction mechanism of Ginkgo Biloba metabolites in Alzheimer's disease and assess their multitarget potential and antioxidant activity.
results_summary: The study found that Ginkgo Biloba extracts, particularly ethanol and ethyl acetate extracts, showed significant inhibition (over 80%) of enzymes linked to Alzheimer's disease and exhibited strong antioxidant activity. The compounds kaempferol, quercetin, and luteolin demonstrated multitarget potential against Alzheimer's through enzyme inhibition and ROS reduction.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico and in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) could alleviate fatty liver hemorrhagic syndrome (FLHS) in laying hens by modulating gut microbiota and its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: GBE treatment improved blood biochemical indicators, reduced liver lipid accumulation, enhanced antioxidant activity, and downregulated lipid synthesis and inflammatory genes. It also reshaped gut microbiota, increased beneficial SCFAs, and fecal microbiota transplantation confirmed the gut microbiota's role in FLHS alleviation.
population_specificity: High-fat diet-induced FLHS laying hens

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba extract (EGb-761) exerts neuroprotective effects against ischemic stroke by modulating the autophagic/lysosomal signaling pathway.
results_summary: EGb-761 promoted autophagic activity (Beclin1, LC3-II) and lysosomal degradation (p62, ubiquitinated proteins), reducing infarct size, neurological deficits, and neuron death in a rat model of ischemic stroke.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats with induced ischemic stroke (MCAO model).
effective_dosage: Administered once daily (specific dosage not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the role of GbbZIP08 in promoting flavonoid accumulation and its impact on flavonoid biosynthesis-related genes in plants.
results_summary: Overexpression of GbbZIP08 significantly increased total flavonoids, kaempferol, and anthocyanin content in transgenic tobacco compared to wild type, and upregulated structural genes in the flavonoid biosynthesis pathway. Phytohormone signal transduction pathways and various transcription factors were also differentially expressed.
population_specificity: Transgenic tobacco plants (not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of Ginkgo Biloba Extract's flavonoid glycoside fraction on vanadium-induced oxidative damage and neuroinflammation in rats.
results_summary: Ginkgo Biloba Extract (GBE) increased markers of oxidative stress (Glutathione Peroxidase and Catalase), improved neuronal cell count, and reduced NLRP3 Inflammasome-positive cells, demonstrating protective effects against vanadium-induced brain damage.
population_specificity: Vanadium-treated rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective effects of Ginkgo Biloba (EGb-761) and BN-52021, delivered via TiO2 nanowires, in a rat model of spinal cord injury under cold conditions.
results_summary: The study found that nanowired delivery of EGb-761 and BN-52021, combined with cerebrolysin, significantly reduced spinal cord pathology and provided superior neuroprotection in cold-acclimated rats. The treatment mitigated oxidative stress, blood-brain barrier permeability, and cell damage.
population_specificity: Cold-acclimated rats with spinal cord injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the risks of adverse drug reactions (ADRs) associated with Ginkgo biloba extract in ophthalmology and emphasize the need for proper patient selection and monitoring.
results_summary: The study reported a severe anaphylactic shock case following Ginkgo biloba administration, underscoring the potential for life-threatening ADRs despite no prior allergy history. It stressed the importance of immediate intervention, monitoring, and adherence to safety protocols.
population_specificity: Middle-aged patient without a history of allergies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms of action of Ginkgo Biloba leaves (GBLs) in treating vascular dementia (VD) using network pharmacology, molecular docking, and molecular dynamics simulations.
results_summary: The study identified 27 active ingredients in GBLs and 274 potential targets for VD treatment, with quercetin, luteolin, kaempferol, and ginkgolide B as core ingredients. Key biological processes involved apoptosis, inflammation, and hypoxia response, with PI3K/Akt signaling as a critical pathway, supported by strong molecular docking and dynamics results.
population_specificity: Vascular dementia (VD) patients (inferred from study focus, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a novel Ginkgo biloba extract (nGBE) on inflammation, white matter integrity, and long-term neurological function in a mouse model of cerebral ischemia.
results_summary: nGBE significantly reduced infarct volume, improved sensorimotor and cognitive functions, inhibited IL-1β release, promoted microglial ramification, regulated microglial phenotype shift, and enhanced white matter integrity post-stroke.
population_specificity: Male C57/BL6 mice subjected to transient or distal middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO).
study_duration: Effects assessed at 1, 3, 7, 14, and 28 days post-ischemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy and safety of Ginkgo biloba dropping pills (GBDPs) in improving angina frequency and quality of life in patients with stable angina pectoris and depression symptoms.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results, as the study appears to be ongoing or not yet completed.
population_specificity: 72 participants aged 18-75 with depression and coronary heart disease with stable angina pectoris, plus 30 healthy individuals for mechanistic investigation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether co-administration of St. John's wort and Ginkgo biloba extracts could suppress tinnitus symptoms compared to Ginkgo biloba extract alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in tinnitus symptoms with co-administration of St. John's wort and Ginkgo biloba compared to Ginkgo biloba alone. The control group (Ginkgo biloba only) showed a significant decrease in Tinnitus Handicap Inventory scores, while the co-administration group showed only a marginal, non-significant improvement.
population_specificity: Participants aged 30-70 years with subjective tinnitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo biloba extract (GBE) could prevent and treat inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) by modulating intestinal microbiota and related metabolites.
results_summary: Pre-treatment with GBE protected mice from Citrobacter Rodentium-induced colitis by modulating intestinal microbiota, increasing short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs), reducing pro-inflammatory factors, up-regulating anti-inflammatory factors, and enhancing intestinal barrier proteins.
population_specificity: Mice with Citrobacter Rodentium-induced colitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb) combined with novelty could enhance the consolidation and persistence of object location memory in young adult and aged rats.
results_summary: EGb treatment associated with novelty improved short-term memory (lasting 1 hour) and long-term memory (persisting 24 hours) in both young adult and aged rats, with particularly robust effects on long-term memory in aged rats.
population_specificity: Young adult and aged rats

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of adjuvant Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) in the treatment of sudden hearing loss (SHL) compared to general treatments alone.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that GBE combined with general treatments significantly improved total effective rate, pure tone hearing threshold, and hemorheology indexes compared to general treatments alone, with no significant difference in hematocrit levels.
population_specificity: Patients with sudden sensorineural hearing loss (SHL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba extract (EGb) could alleviate cisplatin-induced renal interstitial fibrosis (RIF) and explore its potential mechanism via the HIF-1α/STAT3/IL-6 pathway.
results_summary: EGb reduced renal damage and fibrosis in rats, lowered levels of fibrosis-related markers (α-SMA, HIF-1α, STAT3, IL-6), and inhibited fibroblast activation by modulating the HIF-1α/STAT3/IL-6 pathway in renal tubular epithelial cells.
population_specificity: Rats and HK-2 (human kidney-2) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the cognitive-related effects of EGb 761® treatment in patients after acute ischemic stroke and evaluate the feasibility of patient selection and outcome measures.
results_summary: EGb 761® treatment significantly improved global cognitive function and specific cognitive domains compared to the reference group, with minimal adverse events reported (≤3%). The study concluded that EGb 761® enhanced cognitive performance in mild to moderate ischemic stroke patients over 24 weeks.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥50 years with mild to moderate ischemic stroke (NIHSS score ≤20) enrolled 7-14 days post-stroke.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Ginkgo biloba extract EGb 761 on cognitive and neuropsychiatric symptoms in patients with mild neurocognitive disorder (mild NCD) according to DSM-5 criteria.
results_summary: EGb 761 showed beneficial effects in cognitive domains (memory, processing speed, attention, executive functioning) and neuropsychiatric symptoms (depression, anxiety), with no significant differences in adverse events compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Patients with mild neurocognitive disorder (mild NCD) as per DSM-5 criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo biloba supplementation could mitigate lead-induced endothelial and testicular dysfunctions by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: Ginkgo biloba supplementation reduced oxidative stress, restored antioxidant enzyme levels, decreased inflammatory markers, and normalized reproductive hormone levels in lead-exposed animals. It also improved endothelial function and testicular weight.
population_specificity: Animals (specific species not mentioned) exposed to lead acetate.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of ginkgo biloba preparations combined with donepezil hydrochloride versus donepezil alone for treating Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that ginkgo biloba combined with donepezil significantly improved clinical effectiveness and cognitive outcomes compared to donepezil alone, with no statistically significant difference in adverse reactions. However, the overall methodological quality of the included RCTs was poor.
population_specificity: Patients with Alzheimer's disease (1,642 participants across 18 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the pharmacological effects of Ginkgo biloba component-based Chinese medicine (GBCCM) at different doses and ratios, focusing on its potential for lowering blood pressure, regulating stem cell proliferation, and melanogenesis.
results_summary: GBCCM affected multiple signal pathways, including unsaturated fatty acids and bile acids, and showed synergistic effects in hypertension and tyrosinase models at specific ratios (3:2 and 1:1). FAs promoted rat bone marrow mesenchymal stem cell proliferation at 0.2 μg/ml.
population_specificity: Normal mice, rat bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells (BMSCs), and spontaneously hypertensive rats (SHRs).
effective_dosage: 4.4 mg/kg (3:2 ratio for hypertension), 0.4 mg/ml (1:1 ratio for tyrosinase), and 0.2 μg/ml (FAs for BMSC proliferation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism by which a Ginkgo golden leaf extract (GGLE) inhibits melanoma cell invasion and angiogenesis.
results_summary: GGLE inhibited melanoma cell invasion and angiogenesis by suppressing angiogenin synthesis and secretion, rather than through direct cytotoxicity. The effects were dose-dependent and observed under both normoxia and hypoxia conditions.
population_specificity: Melanoma cells and human endothelial cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) provides additional benefits when used as an adjunct to statin therapy in treating hyperlipidaemia, focusing on pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics.
results_summary: The study found that combining GBE with statins significantly improved blood lipid parameters, reduced liver fat content, and decreased adipocyte size in abdominal fat compared to statin therapy alone. GBE also provided liver protection and enhanced plasma statin exposure, suggesting regulatory effects on lipid metabolism.
population_specificity: Rats fed a high-fat diet to induce hyperlipidaemia.
interactions: Increased plasma statin exposure when combined with GBE.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and analyze WRKY transcription factors in Ginkgo biloba and their roles in stress response regulation.
results_summary: The study identified 37 WRKY genes in Ginkgo biloba, which showed varied expression patterns under different abiotic stresses like UV-B radiation, drought, high temperature, and salt treatment. Phylogenetic analysis suggested these genes may play a crucial role in multiple stress tolerances.
population_specificity: Ginkgo biloba (plant study, not human subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ginkgo Biloba extract (GBE) could enhance the neuroprotective effects of curcumin in Alzheimer's disease by improving its brain concentration.
results_summary: The combination of curcumin and GBE significantly increased curcumin levels in the brain and plasma, improved cognitive function, and reduced AD-like alterations in rats, including lower levels of AChE, caspase-3, Aβ1-42, p-tau, and pro-inflammatory cytokines compared to curcumin alone.
population_specificity: Rats with scopolamine-heavy metal mixture-induced AD-like symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory and disease-modifying potential of glucosamine sulphate combined with ibuprofen nanocrystals in a polymeric gel (IBU-GS-NCs gel) for treating osteoarthritis in a rat model.
results_summary: The study found that IBU-GS-NCs gel significantly improved cartilage regeneration, reduced inflammatory markers (COX-2, TNF-α, IL-1β), and enhanced drug permeation compared to controls, suggesting strong anti-inflammatory and cartilage-protective effects.
population_specificity: Osteoarthritic rat model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of 4-deoxy-N-acetylglucosamine peracetate as a substrate reduction therapy for reducing heparan sulfate (HS) accumulation in Mucopolysaccharidosis (MPS) III.
results_summary: The compound significantly reduced HS levels in cultured MPS IIIA patient and mouse fibroblasts, as well as in MPS IIIC Drosophila, and showed evidence of crossing the blood-brain barrier in MPS IIIA mice. These findings suggest potential benefits in slowing HS accumulation for MPS III and related disorders.
population_specificity: MPS IIIA and IIIC patient fibroblasts, MPS IIIA mice, and MPS IIIC Drosophila.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of glucosamine selenium (GASe) on chronic colitis and investigate its regulatory mechanisms, including gut microbiota, pyroptosis, and chemokine signaling pathways.
results_summary: GASe showed no significant toxicity in mice, improved colonic tissue structure, reduced inflammatory cytokines (IL-12, IL-6, TNF-α), and modulated gut microbiota diversity. It also suppressed pyroptosis-related proteins (NLRP3, GSDMD, caspase-1) and inhibited chemokine signaling pathways in chronic colitis.
population_specificity: Mice with chronic DSS-induced colitis.
effective_dosage: Low-GASe and high-GASe (specific amounts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether N-acetyl glucosamine-conjugated hyperbranched polymers could enhance targeted delivery and cytotoxic effects of doxorubicin in breast cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that N-acetyl glucosamine-conjugated H40 Boltorn™ nanocarriers improved doxorubicin accumulation in cancer cells and demonstrated enhanced cytotoxic effects in MDA-MB-231 and 4T1 breast cancer cell lines compared to unmodified versions.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cell lines (MDA-MB-231 and 4T1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antitumor effects of glucosamine and its underlying mechanism in a mouse hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) cell line, Hepa1-6.
results_summary: Glucosamine inhibited Hepa1-6 cell proliferation by inducing ER stress-induced apoptosis and autophagy, and by suppressing aerobic glycolysis (Warburg effect). It upregulated tumor suppressors FoxO1 and FoxO3 and reduced glycolytic flux, lactate, and ATP production.
population_specificity: Mouse hepatocellular carcinoma cell line (Hepa1-6).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of glucosamine on mortality and disease progression in patients with metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) and metabolic dysfunction and alcohol-associated liver disease (MetALD).
results_summary: Glucosamine significantly reduced all-cause mortality and liver cirrhosis incidence in MASLD, lowered cardiovascular disease risk in both MASLD and MetALD, and decreased chronic kidney disease incidence in MASLD and the entire cohort, but showed no significant effect on cerebrovascular disease.
population_specificity: Patients with MASLD and MetALD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the most effective glucosamine combination therapy for reducing pain in knee osteoarthritis (KOA) patients.
results_summary: Glucosamine combined with omega-3 or ibuprofen significantly reduced overall pain compared to placebo, with moderate-quality evidence. Glucosamine + chondroitin sulfate + methylsulfonylmethane also showed effectiveness but with low-quality evidence.
population_specificity: Patients with knee osteoarthritis (5265 participants across 30 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Glucosamine on myoblast proliferation, differentiation, and myotube development in C2C12 cells, as well as its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Glucosamine significantly reduced myoblast proliferation and differentiation, suppressed myotube formation, and induced skeletal muscle atrophy by inhibiting protein synthesis pathways, including phosphorylation of Stat3, S6K, Akt, and mTOR. These effects were mediated through ER stress.
population_specificity: C2C12 myoblast cells and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-angiogenic and protective effects of micronized N-Palmitoyl-d-glucosamine (mPGA) in a mouse model of colitis-associated colorectal carcinoma (CRC).
results_summary: mPGA improved disease progression and survival rates, reduced polyp formation, decreased pro-angiogenic and pro-inflammatory markers, and inhibited VEGF and MMP-9 secretion by disrupting the pAkt/mTOR/HIF1α pathway. It also restored anti-tumoral PPARα and wtp53 protein expression.
population_specificity: C57BL/6J mice with induced colitis-associated CRC.
interactions: PPARα inhibitor MK886 (10 mg/kg) was used to assess dependency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate glucosamine sulfate's potential as an inhibitor of genes involved in osteoarthritis development and assess its molecular interactions and toxicity.
results_summary: Glucosamine sulfate showed stable binding affinity with MMP-3, MMP-9, and IL-4, suggesting inhibitory effects on OA-related genes, but exhibited toxicity at high concentrations in RAW 264.7 cells.
population_specificity: In vitro study using RAW 264.7 cells (murine macrophage cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Glucosamine could restore O-GlcNAcylation levels and improve learning and memory function following traumatic brain injury in zebrafish.
results_summary: Glucosamine treatment significantly restored O-GlcNAcylation levels and improved learning and memory function, while also reducing GFAP activation. Glucose treatment also aided recovery, but this effect was blocked by inhibition of the hexosamine biosynthetic pathway.
population_specificity: Adult zebrafish with needle stab-induced optic tectum injury
study_duration: Treatment administered at 3 days post-injury, effects observed up to 30 days post-injury

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining modified San Bi Tang with glucosamine sulfate capsules enhances clinical efficacy in treating cold-dampness-type knee osteoarthritis compared to glucosamine alone.
results_summary: The combination treatment improved knee joint function and TCM-specific symptoms more effectively than glucosamine alone, with no reported adverse effects on liver or kidney function.
population_specificity: 110 middle-aged and elderly patients with cold-dampness-type knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop chitosan-based nanoparticles to enhance the bioavailability of edoxaban tosylate monohydrate (ETM) for oral administration and evaluate its anticoagulant activity.
