results_summary: The study successfully optimized ETM-loaded chitosan nanoparticles (ETM-CS-NPs) with favorable particle size, zeta potential, and encapsulation efficiency. In vitro assays demonstrated the nanoparticles' anticoagulant activity via aPTT, PT, and TT tests.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effect of intravesical glucosamine in treating overactive bladder (OAB) in rats.
results_summary: Glucosamine treatment significantly improved urodynamic parameters, including elevated leak point pressure (LPP) and prolonged inter-contractile interval (ICI), compared to control and other treatment groups.
population_specificity: Female Sprague-Dawley rats with induced overactive bladder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare functional performance outcomes between oral patented crystalline glucosamine sulfate (pCGS) and platelet-rich plasma (PRP) in patients with knee osteoarthritis over a one-year follow-up period.
results_summary: The pCGS group showed significant improvements in functional performance tests (5xSST, TUGT, and 3MWDT) from 12 weeks onward, with sustained benefits at 24 weeks and 1 year. Both treatments were effective, though PRP showed faster initial improvements in some tests.
population_specificity: Patients with knee osteoarthritis (382 in pCGS group, 122 in PRP group, matched to 204 pCGS and 102 PRP for analysis).
study_duration: 1 year (with assessments at baseline, 6, 12, 24 weeks, and 1 year).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether glucosamine treatment reduces cancer incidence in patients with osteoarthritis, addressing potential selection bias in prior observational studies.
results_summary: The study found no significant reduction in overall cancer incidence (HR 0.97) or specific cancers (lung, colorectal, breast, prostate) with glucosamine treatment compared to non-users, suggesting it does not prevent cancer in osteoarthritis patients.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with osteoarthritis in the UK (1995-2017).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate curcumin analog delivery systems using glucosamine-based hydrogels for potential medical applications.
results_summary: The study synthesized and characterized four half-curcuminoid compounds, encapsulated them in glucosamine-based hydrogels, and explored their potential for antitumor and neurological treatments, though specific efficacy results for glucosamine itself were not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of glucosamine in treating temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJ OA) by comparing it to control groups using ibuprofen and tramadol.
results_summary: Glucosamine showed non-significant but discernible effects on increasing maximum mouth opening and reducing pain in TMJ-related disorders, with slightly more favorable outcomes compared to ibuprofen and tramadol. However, methodological variability calls for further longitudinal studies to confirm efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJ OA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate C2-functionalized Pt(IV) glycoconjugates based on glucosamine as targeted anticancer agents, exploiting the Warburg Effect and GLUT receptor overexpression in cancer cells.
results_summary: The study synthesized and characterized glucosamine-conjugated Pt(IV) complexes with varying linker lengths and acetyl protection, demonstrating their potential as anticancer agents in 2D and 3D cancer cell lines. The C2 position of glucosamine was utilized for drug conjugation, enhancing targeted delivery.
population_specificity: Cancer cell lines (2D and 3D models)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the functional roles of glucosamine in cartilage homeostasis, focusing on its effects on cellular processes like proliferation, ROS generation, and glycosylation modifications in human chondrocytes.
results_summary: Glucosamine suppressed N-glycosylation of specific proteins, induced dose-dependent cell proliferation, modulated mitochondrial and cytosol ROS generation, altered cell cycle profiles, and affected endoplasmic reticulum stress and O-GlcNAcylation status in TC28a2 cells. It also showed cytotoxicity at higher doses.
population_specificity: TC28a2 cell line (human chondrocytes)
effective_dosage: 1 µM (specific concentrations for other effects not detailed)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate an emulgel formulation of Glucosamine Sulphate Potassium Chloride (GSPC) for controlled-release local application in osteoarthritis treatment.
results_summary: The optimized emulgel formulation (F6) showed 88% drug release after 6 hours, following the Higuchi model, indicating effective controlled-release potential for GSPC in osteoarthritis treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (implied osteoarthritis patients).
effective_dosage: 60 mg GSPC in the optimized microemulsion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory properties of two bi-deoxygenated N-acetyl glucosamine (NAG) derivatives, BNAG1 and BNAG2, compared to the parent molecule NAG, using in vivo and in vitro inflammation models.
results_summary: BNAG1 showed the highest inhibition of IL-6 and TNF-α levels in serum and reduced leukocyte migration in LPS-challenged mice, as well as suppressed cytokine production in macrophages. BNAG2 exhibited anti-inflammatory effects comparable to NAG, suggesting potential therapeutic applications for inflammation-related diseases.
population_specificity: LPS-challenged mice and LPS-stimulated primary peritoneal macrophages.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the biofilm inhibition properties of glucosamine gold nanoparticles (AuNPs), both alone and in combination with meropenem, against Pseudomonas aeruginosa on endotracheal tubes.
results_summary: Glucosamine AuNPs at 0.02 mg/mL combined with meropenem at 1 mg/mL showed significantly greater biofilm inhibition (72%) compared to glucosamine nanoparticles alone (26%). Scanning electron microscopy confirmed reduced biofilm density in treated samples.
population_specificity: Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 9027 on endotracheal tubes (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the protective effect and mechanism of Glucosamine (GLC) on alcohol-induced liver injury in mice and human hepatocyte cells.
results_summary: GLC significantly improved liver injury biomarkers, lipid metabolism, oxidative stress, and inflammatory factors by inhibiting CYP2E1, activating the Keap1/Nrf2/HO-1 pathway, and downregulating MAPK and NF-κB signaling. It also reduced levels of inflammatory cytokines like TNF-α, IL-1β, and IL-6.
population_specificity: Mice and human normal hepatocyte L02 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether a 3:1 mixture of palmitoyl-glucosamine (PGA) and hesperidin (HSP) could effectively manage chronic cystitis in a rat model.
results_summary: The higher dose of PGA-HSP significantly reduced chronic visceral pain, improved cystitis severity, decreased inflammation markers, and preserved urothelial function. It also counteracted neuroinflammatory changes and mast cell accumulation.
population_specificity: Rats with cyclophosphamide-induced chronic cystitis.
effective_dosage: Low dose (72 mg/kg PGA + 24 mg/kg HSP) and high dose (doubled).
study_duration: 13 days (starting 3 days before chronic CYP protocol).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the inhibitory effect of N-acetyl-D-glucosamine (D-GlcNAc) on breast cancer using machine learning and confirmatory assays.
results_summary: D-GlcNAc significantly reduced cell proliferation, increased apoptosis and Fas expression in breast cancer cell lines, and decreased tumor size, mitosis, and angiogenesis in a xenograft mouse model. Molecular docking analysis suggested high binding affinity to HER2, indicating a potential mechanism of action.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cell lines (MCF-7 and 4T1) and a xenograft mouse model.
effective_dosage: 0.5 mM, 1 mM, 2 mM, and 4 mM in vitro; 2 mM intraperitoneally daily in vivo.
study_duration: 72 hours in vitro; 28 days in vivo.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a nutritional supplement containing glucosamine sulfate, among other ingredients, in reducing pain and improving function in patients with knee and/or hip osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in self-perceived pain and improvements in functional indices (Lequesne and WOMAC) after 3 and 6 months of treatment, with no severe adverse events reported.
population_specificity: 186 patients with knee and/or hip osteoarthritis recruited from Spanish centers.
effective_dosage: 700 mg glucosamine sulfate once daily (as part of a multi-ingredient supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of glucosamine as a treatment for temporomandibular joint (TMJ) osteoarthritis, particularly its role in cartilage repair and inflammation management.
results_summary: Glucosamine showed potential benefits in TMJ osteoarthritis, possibly due to its role in hyaluronic acid regulation and balancing anabolism/catabolism in articular tissues, but its efficacy remains inconclusive despite systematic reviews. It is suggested as an adjunct to conventional treatments with moderate prognosis.
population_specificity: Patients with temporomandibular joint (TMJ) osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a dual-sensitive polymer nanoplatform for co-delivering glucosamine (GlcN) and tofacitinib (Tof) to enhance cartilage repair and anti-inflammatory effects in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) treatment.
results_summary: The study found that the dual pH/ROS-sensitive chondroitin sulfate nanoplatform effectively released GlcN in acidic joint environments for cartilage repair and triggered rapid Tof/GlcN release via micelle disassembly in macrophages, promoting M1-to-M2 polarization and attenuating inflammation. Synergistic effects of GlcN and Tof were confirmed in vitro and in vivo.
population_specificity: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) models (in vitro and in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate glucosamine's effects against radiation-induced brain oxidative stress and depression-like behavior in rats.
results_summary: Glucosamine administration improved behavioral responses and biochemical parameters in irradiated rats, including oxidative stress markers, neurotransmitter levels, and glycogen synthase kinase pathway activity. It showed potential as a radioprotector and antidepressant during radiotherapy.
population_specificity: Female Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the detectability of glucosamine uptake and metabolism in the brain using CEST MRI and assess its potential as a metabolic biomarker for brain disorders.
results_summary: The study found that intravenous glucosamine administration in mice led to significantly elevated CEST brain signals, particularly in the cortex, hippocampus, and thalamus, with stable in vivo contrast over 40 minutes. The results suggest glucosamine can cross the blood-brain barrier and may serve as a diagnostic tool for brain disorders.
population_specificity: Mice (murine subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of a combination of glucosamine-sulfate, nonanimal chondroitin-sulfate, and S-adenosylmethionine on ultrasound findings, inflammation, pain, and functionality in knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found a minor increase in articular cartilage thickness in the higher-dose experimental group after six months, but the investigational product's superiority in reducing osteoarthritis ultrasonographic findings was not proven. No significant changes were observed in clinical outcomes (VAS, TLKS, WOMAC, SF-36) or inflammatory markers, except for a baseline association between cartilage thickness and pain intensity.
population_specificity: 120 participants (28 males, 92 females; mean age 66.4±7.9 years) with knee osteoarthritis.
effective_dosage: Two experimental groups received either 375 mg GS + 300 mg naCS + 100 mg SAMe or 750 mg GS + 600 mg naCS + 200 mg SAMe.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding glucosamine alone or combined with chondroitin to an exercise program improves knee pain and physical function in knee osteoarthritis patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of glucosamine or glucosamine-chondroitin supplementation combined with exercise on knee pain or physical function compared to exercise alone in KOA patients. The meta-analysis showed non-significant results for pain and function outcomes.
population_specificity: Older adults with knee osteoarthritis (297 participants across 6 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of phenolic acid-grafted glucosamine nanoparticles (SA-g-GluNPs) for chondroprotection and antibacterial applications.
results_summary: SA-g-GluNPs demonstrated sustained, pH-dependent drug release, reduced oxidative stress and pro-inflammatory cytokines in human chondrocytes, and improved antibacterial effects against E. coli and S. aureus compared to free SA.
population_specificity: Human chondrocyte C28/I2 cell line

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy of glucosamine hydrochloride combined with compound osteopeptide injection versus compound osteopeptide alone for treating knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
results_summary: The combination treatment showed significantly higher efficacy (95.74%) compared to the control group (80.00%), reduced WOMAC scores, lowered inflammatory markers (TNF-α and IL-6), and improved immune function (higher CD4+ and CD8+ levels).
population_specificity: 82 patients with KOA admitted to Shandong Weifang People's Hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic effects of Glucosamine (GLC) on non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and the underlying mechanisms, including its impact on inflammation, gut microbiota, and liver lipid metabolism.
results_summary: GLC attenuated insulin resistance, inflammation, and oxidative stress while improving liver lipid metabolism and intestinal barrier function in NAFLD mice. It also reduced liver inflammation by inhibiting the LPS/TLR4/NF-κB pathway.
population_specificity: HFHSD-fed mice with induced NAFLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a GlcNAc thermosensitive hydrogel in promoting cartilage repair and reducing apoptosis in rats with cartilage injury.
results_summary: The GlcNAc hydrogel improved behavioral outcomes (longer step lengths, smaller foot angles, slower fall times), increased Sox9 and collagen II expression, reduced apoptosis by 50%, and activated autophagy via the ERK pathway.
population_specificity: Rats with cartilage injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of adding crystalline glucosamine sulfate to standard osteoarthritis treatment at various stages compared to standard treatment alone.
results_summary: Adding glucosamine to standard treatment was more cost-effective, particularly when introduced early. Supplementing glucosamine at any stage was cost-effective at the willingness-to-pay threshold.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Glucosamine on ROS production, O-GlcNAc levels, and Nrf2 expression in human dermal microvascular endothelial cells (HMEC-1), as well as its antioxidant capacity compared to known antioxidants.
results_summary: Glucosamine showed low scavenging activity against various radicals and low antioxidant capacity. At 20 mM, it reduced cell viability by 26%, increased ROS production by 70%, and elevated O-GlcNAc and Nrf2 expression, effects prevented by the O-GlcNAc inhibitor OSMI-1.
population_specificity: Human dermal microvascular endothelial cells (HMEC-1) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of glucosamine in osteoarthritis (OA) treatment and its impact on health resource allocation.
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine was cost-effective in OA treatment, with an increase in quality-adjusted life years (QALYs). Patented crystalline glucosamine sulfate (pCGS) was more cost-effective than other formulations.
population_specificity: Older adults with osteoarthritis.

study_goal: To investigate the effects of glucosamine hydrochloride combined with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs on symptoms and HSS scores in patients with knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine hydrochloride combined with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs reduced inflammatory cytokines, alleviated knee pain and arthritis symptoms, improved knee function, and enhanced HSS scores in KOA patients. The Observation Group showed significant improvements in VAS, WOMAC, and symptom improvement rates compared to the Control Group.
population_specificity: 80 patients with knee osteoarthritis admitted to Cangzhou Hospital of integrated TCM-WM.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential effects of glucosamine on bone turnover, particularly its impact on the RANKL/RANK/OPG pathway.
results_summary: The study suggests glucosamine may influence bone turnover via the RANKL/RANK/OPG pathway, but no comprehensive conclusions are drawn due to a lack of published research.
population_specificity: Not specified (general bone health context)

study_goal: To investigate the effects of glucosamine hydrochloride combined with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs on symptoms and HSS scores in patients with knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine hydrochloride combined with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs reduced inflammatory cytokines, alleviated knee pain and arthritis symptoms, improved knee function, and enhanced HSS scores in KOA patients. The Observation Group showed significant improvements in VAS, WOMAC, and symptom improvement rates compared to the Control Group.
population_specificity: 80 patients with knee osteoarthritis admitted to Cangzhou Hospital of integrated TCM-WM from February 2016 to December 2019.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of crystalline glucosamine sulfate (CGS) in reducing symptoms and delaying the progression of knee osteoarthritis (OA) compared to NSAID treatment.
results_summary: CGS significantly reduced pain intensity compared to NSAIDs but did not delay the progression of joint structure damage in knee OA patients. Both treatments showed pain reduction, but CGS was more effective symptomatically.
population_specificity: 111 patients of both genders with knee OA attending a specialized rheumatic diseases hospital in Serbia (2011-2013).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of glucosamine in reducing pain and improving function in knee osteoarthritis patients.
results_summary: Glucosamine significantly reduced global pain compared to placebo (measured by VAS), with modest improvements in pain, stiffness, and physical function (measured by WOMAC). No serious adverse events or medication interactions were reported.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if glucosamine-labeled liposomal ceramide could target tumor hypoxia and enhance cancer therapy by exploiting GLUT1-mediated transcytosis.
results_summary: Glucosamine-labeled liposomal ceramide efficiently accumulated in hypoxic tumor areas, disrupted cancer stem cell networks, and showed synergistic effects with paclitaxel and carboplatin, leading to tumor clearance in most mice.
population_specificity: In vitro CSC spheroids and in vivo tumor xenografts (mice).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between regular glucosamine intake and heart failure (HF) and explore whether this association is mediated by cardiovascular diseases like coronary heart disease and stroke.
results_summary: The study found that regular glucosamine supplementation was associated with a lower risk of HF (HR 0.87) and was protective against HF in Mendelian randomization analysis (HR 0.92). The effect was partially mediated by coronary heart disease (10.5%) and stroke (14.4%).
population_specificity: 479,650 participants from the UK Biobank study without HF at baseline.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of glucosamine combined with chondroitin sulfate on clinical outcomes in patients with knee and hip osteoarthritis in routine clinical practice.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in pain, symptoms, physical function, and quality of life, along with reduced NSAID use. Treatment-related adverse events were low (2.8%), primarily gastrointestinal disorders.
population_specificity: 1102 patients (87.8% women, mean age 60.4) with knee or hip osteoarthritis (Kellgren & Lawrence grades I-III) in the Russian Federation.
effective_dosage: 500 mg glucosamine hydrochloride and 400 mg chondroitin sulfate, starting with 3 capsules daily for 3 weeks, then reduced to 2 capsules daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how Glucosamine (GlcN) affects circadian rhythms and its potential therapeutic use for circadian misalignment.
results_summary: Glucosamine induced circadian phase delay independently of O-GlcNAcylation by up-regulating p-AMPK activity, inhibiting mTOR signaling, and promoting BMAL1 degradation via the proteasome pathway. These findings suggest GlcN's potential for treating shift work and circadian misalignment.
population_specificity: Human cell line and mouse tissues.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of glucosamine (AG) in enhancing the antitumor effects of sorafenib (SF) when delivered via a targeted micelle system (SF-APSP) in liver cancer.
results_summary: Glucosamine enhanced the antitumor effects of SF, with SF-APSP micelles showing high release in tumor microenvironments and significant inhibition of HepG2 cell proliferation. In vivo studies confirmed superior antitumor efficacy and tolerance compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Nude mice with HepG2 liver cancer cells (in vivo); HepG2 cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of different glucosamine formulations for managing osteoarthritis in Thailand compared to placebo.
results_summary: Prescription-grade crystalline glucosamine sulfate (pCGS) was found to be cost-effective over 3 and 6 months, while other glucosamine formulations (e.g., glucosamine hydrochloride) did not reach cost-effectiveness.
population_specificity: Osteoarthritis patients in Thailand.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a keratin/chitosan/glucosamine sulfate (KRT/CS/GLS) composite loaded with functionalized multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MWCNTs) as a potential carrier for osteoarthritis treatment and to evaluate its binding affinity with targeted proteins.
results_summary: The nanocomposite showed effective incorporation of KRT/CS/GLS on MWCNTs, high thermal stability (420 °C), and 83% cell viability in RAW 264.7 cells at 500 μg ml-1. Molecular docking revealed strong binding affinity of D-glucosamine to targeted proteins (PDB ID: 1HJV and 1ALU).
population_specificity: RAW 264.7 cells (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Maximum concentration tested was 500 μg ml-1 of MWCNT-GLS/KRT/CS nanocomposite.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of a nutritional supplement containing Glucosamine, type II collagen, and vitamin C in treating various tendinopathies compared to a placebo.
results_summary: The study found that 90% of patients experienced complete pain relief after 6 months of treatment with the supplement, with maximum benefits observed around 24 weeks. The supplement was more effective in non-athletes than athletes.
population_specificity: 80 patients with various tendinopathies (60 treated with the supplement, 20 with placebo) at Konaseema Institute of Medical Sciences (2017-2019).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of glucosamine (GS), chondroitin sulphate (CS), and their combination (GC) on rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in rats, focusing on gut microbiota and inflammatory pathways.
results_summary: The combination GC reduced paw swelling and inflammatory markers (TLR-4, NF-κB) in RA rats, while GS alone did not show significant effects. GC also inhibited harmful gut bacteria linked to inflammation and improved gut microbiota dysbiosis before joint swelling alleviation.
population_specificity: Rat models of rheumatoid arthritis induced by CFA injection.
study_duration: Intervention lasted from day 14 to day 36 after CFA injection (22 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a case of delayed allergic reaction to glucosamine chondroitin in a patient taking the supplement for lumbar degenerative joint disease.
results_summary: A 36-year-old woman developed a widespread itchy rash and facial swelling within hours of taking glucosamine chondroitin, suggesting an allergic reaction. The symptoms resolved after discontinuing the supplement and administering antihistamines and steroids.
population_specificity: 36-year-old woman with lumbar degenerative joint disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically assess the efficacy of oral glucosamine in treating temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJ OA) based on existing literature.
results_summary: The study found that oral glucosamine, when administered for at least 3 months, significantly reduced TMJ pain and increased maximum mouth opening, with long-term anti-inflammatory effects. However, there was insufficient scientific evidence to conclusively confirm its clinical effectiveness for TMJ OA.
population_specificity: Individuals with temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJ OA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate in alleviating canine hip osteoarthritis (OA) pain compared to other treatments.
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine/chondroitin did not result in significant improvements in peak vertical force (PVF) compared to placebo, while other treatments (PCSO-524, EAB-277, and carprofen) showed significant improvements. Subjective orthopedic assessment scores (OAS) did not show significant changes in any group.
population_specificity: Seventy-five owned pet dogs with hip osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of combining diacerein and glucosamine hydrochloride in treating knee osteoarthritis and their impact on inflammatory factors.
results_summary: The combination therapy showed a higher overall response rate, lower adverse event rate, and significant reductions in pain scores (Lequesne Index, VAS) and inflammatory markers compared to diacerein alone.
population_specificity: 116 knee osteoarthritis patients (55 in control group, 61 in observation group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a gel combining glucosamine sulfate and chondroitin sulfate affected TMJ spaces, pain, and tension levels in patients with skeletal Class II malocclusion treated with removable functional appliances.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in TMJ joint spaces, pain, or tension levels between the group using the glucosamine-chondroitin gel and the control group, though both groups showed gradual decreases in pain and tension over time.
population_specificity: 36 patients aged 10-13 years with skeletal Class II malocclusion due to mandibular retrusion, at pubertal growth spurt stage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the radioprotective ability of glucosamine against radiation-induced genotoxicity and cytotoxicity in human peripheral blood lymphocytes.
results_summary: Pretreatment with glucosamine significantly reduced the frequency of radiation-induced micronuclei, prevented apoptosis in lymphocytes, and decreased reactive oxygen species (ROS) production. The study suggests glucosamine has potential as a radioprotector against DNA damage and apoptosis caused by radiation.
population_specificity: Five healthy male donors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the chondroprotective effects of glucosamine in combination with chondroitin sulfate for articular cartilage protection in osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate, when administered together, activate a larger number of cartilage matrix proteins than individually, improving cartilage conditions. The combination was noted to be biologically compatible and effective for long-term use depending on cartilage degradation severity.
population_specificity: Patients with osteoarthritis and varying degrees of cartilage damage (1-3 on the Kellgren and Lawrence scale).
study_duration: Several to several months (duration dependent on cartilage degradation severity).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if dietary integration with palmitoyl-glucosamine co-micronized with curcumin could maintain pain relief in dogs with osteoarthritis (OA) chronic pain while reducing meloxicam dosage.
results_summary: The study found that 90% of dogs could reduce meloxicam dosage by 25% without pain worsening, and 75% showed no pain increase ten weeks after meloxicam withdrawal. Pain severity significantly decreased based on owner and veterinary assessments.
population_specificity: Dogs with severe osteoarthritis-associated chronic pain.
effective_dosage: Not specified for palmitoyl-glucosamine and curcumin; meloxicam was administered at 0.1 mg/kg/day initially, then tapered by 25% biweekly.
study_duration: 18 weeks (8 weeks of meloxicam tapering followed by 10 weeks post-withdrawal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of exogenous glucosamine administration on diabetic nephropathy, focusing on kidney function, mesangial expansion, and endothelial-mesenchymal transition.
results_summary: Glucosamine reduced mesangial expansion and fibronectin expression in diabetic glomeruli and decreased α-SMA protein expression in both diabetic and control kidneys, but did not significantly alter urinary albumin secretion, kidney weight, or creatinine clearance. It also suppressed α-SMA expression in endothelial cells under high glucose conditions.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin-induced diabetic nephropathy mouse model and cultured endothelial cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits and synergistic effects of combining glucosamine sulfate (GS) with NSAIDs in patients with knee osteoarthritis (OA).
results_summary: All five studies reviewed found that the combination of GS and NSAIDs provided significantly greater benefits than either treatment alone, including pain reduction, improved function, reduced joint stiffness, and decreased markers of inflammatory activity and cartilage degradation. The evidence supports the efficacy of the combination in managing knee OA symptoms and possibly regulating joint damage.
population_specificity: Patients with knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop transdermal transfersomes of glucosamine for improved drug delivery and evaluate its effectiveness in treating osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine-loaded transfersomes effectively healed osteoarthritis in rabbits, with radiology studies confirming joint healing and blood plasma analysis remaining unaltered. In vitro characterization showed successful development of nano-deformable entities with good entrapment efficiency but required modification into a gel for stability.
population_specificity: Rabbits with papain-induced arthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if glucosamine could protect against zearalenone-induced reproductive toxicity and placental dysfunction in pregnant mice.
results_summary: Glucosamine significantly alleviated zearalenone-induced growth impairment, placental dysfunction, and oxidative stress in pregnant mice, reversing adverse effects on fetal number, weight, and placental development by modulating PI3K and MAPK signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Pregnant mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects and mechanisms of Glucosamine on senile osteoporosis and osteogenic differentiation in vivo.
results_summary: Glucosamine improved bone mineral density and micro-architecture, reduced skeletal senescence and apoptosis, and increased osteogenesis in D-Gal-induced osteoporotic mice, with effects reversed by autophagy inhibitor 3-MA.
population_specificity: D-Gal-induced senile osteoporotic mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if adding glucosamine moieties to fluoroquinolones could improve their environmental biodegradability while maintaining or enhancing antimicrobial activity.
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine-conjugated fluoroquinolones showed better antimicrobial activity than their parent compounds but were not readily biodegradable. Partial degradation occurred via deacetylation and glucosamine moiety breakdown, yielding Fluoroquinolone-3-carboxamide derivatives.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro/environmental study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the real-world cardiovascular risk associated with long-term glucosamine use in patients with osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Glucosamine usage was significantly associated with increased risks of cardiovascular diseases (CVD) and coronary heart diseases (CHD), but not stroke. The highest CVD risk was observed in adherent users, showing a dose-response relationship.
population_specificity: 685,778 patients newly diagnosed with osteoarthritis in China (mean age 56.49 years, 59.35% female).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if short-term glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate supplementation provided additional benefits when combined with manual therapy and resistance exercise training for knee osteoarthritis management.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in most outcome measures between the group receiving glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate and the control group, except for minor changes in segmental lean mass. The supplement showed no additional benefits over manual therapy and exercise alone.
population_specificity: Knee osteoarthritis patients (grades I-III on Kellgren classification) of either gender, with a majority being male (75%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the appropriate conversion factor for dietary folate equivalents (DFE) for 5-MTHF glucosamine salt compared to folic acid and natural food folate.
results_summary: The study found that 5-MTHF glucosamine salt has a bioavailability similar to folic acid at intakes <400 μg/day (conversion factor 1.7) and higher bioavailability at ≥400 μg/day (conversion factor 2). The proposed DFE equations account for these differences.
population_specificity: Adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of micronized N-palmitoyl-D-glucosamine (PGA) in reducing colitis severity and improving intestinal mucosa integrity in a preclinical model of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
results_summary: Micronized PGA significantly and dose-dependently reduced colitis severity, improved intestinal mucosa integrity by increasing tight junction protein expression, and downregulated the TLR-4/NLRP3/iNOS pathway via PPAR-α receptor signaling in DNBS-treated mice.
population_specificity: DNBS-treated mice (preclinical model of IBD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the extent of bias, particularly selection bias, in observational studies reporting beneficial effects of glucosamine on mortality and disease incidence.
results_summary: The study identified 11 observational studies showing a mean 16% reduction in all-cause mortality and significant reductions in cancer incidence and other major diseases with glucosamine use, but concluded these effects likely resulted from selection bias due to collider stratification.
population_specificity: Prevalent cohorts where glucosamine use started before cohort entry and subjects agreed to join the cohorts (e.g., UK Biobank participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a linoleic acid and glucosamine hybrid (LA-GlcN) in treating high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) by targeting GLUT 1 and inducing ferroptosis.
results_summary: LA-GlcN selectively killed HGSOC cells without affecting normal cells in vitro and showed comparable tumor inhibition to doxorubicin in vivo at 50 mg kg-1, with improved outcomes at 100 mg kg-1 and extended survival due to low toxicity.
population_specificity: High-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) cells and normal ovarian cells, tested in vitro and in vivo in mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of chondroitin combined with glucosamine compared to routine treatment for knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found that chondroitin combined with glucosamine was significantly more effective than routine treatment in improving clinical efficacy and reducing joint pain, tenderness, swelling, and dysfunction in knee osteoarthritis patients, with no significant difference in adverse reactions.
population_specificity: Patients with knee osteoarthritis (KOA).

study_goal: To assess the effectiveness of comprehensive rehabilitation therapy plus glucosamine hydrochloride in improving knee function and clinical outcomes in patients with exercise-induced knee injuries.
results_summary: The experimental group receiving glucosamine showed significantly better treatment efficacy, lower pain scores (VAS), reduced inflammation (C-reactive protein), improved knee function (Lysholm scores), and better physical performance (FTSST) compared to the control group.
population_specificity: 96 patients with exercise-induced knee injuries.
effective_dosage: Daily glucosamine hydrochloride tablets (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether glucosamine (GlcN) could protect porcine trophectoderm (pTr) cells from zearalenone (ZEA)-induced apoptosis, oxidative damage, and other toxic effects.
results_summary: Glucosamine significantly alleviated ZEA-induced cell viability decline, G2/M phase arrest, DNA damage, ROS production, and barrier function disruption in pTr cells. It also reduced apoptosis and autophagy, likely mediated by activation of the PI3K/AKT signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Porcine trophectoderm (pTr) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of glucosamine combined with sodium hyaluronate for treating osteoporosis complicated by knee osteoarthritis, focusing on joint function and bone metabolic markers.
results_summary: The study found that glucosamine plus sodium hyaluronate significantly improved joint function, reduced pain, and positively influenced bone metabolic markers compared to glucosamine alone. The combination therapy showed higher clinical efficacy and better outcomes in all measured parameters.
population_specificity: 126 patients with osteoporosis and knee osteoarthritis (76 in the observation group, 50 in the control group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of prescription-grade Crystalline Glucosamine Sulfate (pCGS) as an add-on treatment to conventional therapy in patients with erosive osteoarthritis of the hand (EHOA).
results_summary: The study found that pCGS significantly improved hand pain, function, morning stiffness, and quality of life while reducing symptomatic drug consumption, with no serious adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Patients with erosive osteoarthritis of the hand (EHOA) and concomitant knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of an oral compound containing chondroitin sulfate and glucosamine in treating and modulating experimentally induced osteoarthritis in horses.
results_summary: The treatment showed significant improvements in some parameters like lameness and synovial fluid biomarkers, but other measures like joint flexion angle and histopathological analysis did not reach statistical significance. The study concluded that the treatment was clinically effective but may not fully halt cartilage damage progression.
population_specificity: 16 horses with experimentally induced osteoarthritis in the metacarpophalangeal joint.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether glucosamine could act as a pharmacological chaperone to rescue memory deficits and brain pathology caused by misfolded HGSNAT in a mouse model of MPS IIIC.
results_summary: Glucosamine treatment rescued memory deficits and the majority of brain pathology in HgsnatP304L mice, demonstrating its efficacy as a pharmacological chaperone for misfolded HGSNAT. The study also revealed dominant-negative effects of the misfolded HGSNAT variant, which were ameliorated by glucosamine.
population_specificity: HgsnatP304L mice (a model for mucopolysaccharidosis IIIC with misfolded HGSNAT).
